AddUser.document: This API is used to add sub-users.
AddUser.name: Adds sub-Users

AddUserToGroup.document: This API is used to add users to a user group.
AddUserToGroup.name: Adds users to a user group

AttachGroupPolicy.document: This API (AttachGroupPolicy) is used to associate a policy with a user group.
AttachGroupPolicy.name: Associates a policy with a user group

AttachRolePolicy.document: This API (AttachRolePolicy) is used to associate a policy with a role.
AttachRolePolicy.name: Associates a permission policy with a role

AttachUserPolicy.document: This API (AttachUserPolicy) is used to associates a policy with a user.
AttachUserPolicy.name: Associates a policy with a user

ConsumeCustomMFAToken.document: This API is used to verify a custom multi-factor Token.
ConsumeCustomMFAToken.name: Verifies a custom multi-factor Token

CreateGroup.document: This API is used to create a user group.
CreateGroup.name: Creates a user group

CreatePolicy.document: This API (CreatePolicy) is used to create a policy.
CreatePolicy.name: Creates a policy

CreatePolicyVersion.document: This API is used to add a policy version. After creating a policy version, you can easily change the policy by changing the policy version.
CreatePolicyVersion.name: Creates a policy version

CreateRole.document: This API (CreateRole) is used to create a role.
CreateRole.name: Creates a role

CreateSAMLProvider.document: This API is used to create a SAML identity provider.
CreateSAMLProvider.name: Creates a SAML identity provider

CreateServiceLinkedRole.document: This API is used to create a service-linked role.
CreateServiceLinkedRole.name: Creates a service-linked role

DeleteGroup.document: This API is used to delete a user group.
DeleteGroup.name: Deletes a user group

DeletePolicy.document: This API (DeletePolicy) is used to delete a policy.
DeletePolicy.name: Deletes a policy

DeletePolicyVersion.document: This API is used to delete a policy version of a policy.
DeletePolicyVersion.name: Deletes a policy version

DeleteRole.document: This API (DeleteRole) is used to delete a specified role.
DeleteRole.name: Deletes a role

DeleteRolePermissionsBoundary.document: This API is used to delete a role permission boundary.
DeleteRolePermissionsBoundary.name: Deletes role permission boundary

DeleteSAMLProvider.document: This API is used to delete a SAML identity provider.
DeleteSAMLProvider.name: Deletes a SAML identity provider

DeleteServiceLinkedRole.document: This API is used to delete a service-linked role.
DeleteServiceLinkedRole.name: Deletes a service-linked role

DeleteUser.document: This API is used to delete a sub-user.
DeleteUser.name: Deletes a sub-user

DeleteUserPermissionsBoundary.document: This API is used to delete a user permission boundary.
DeleteUserPermissionsBoundary.name: Deletes user permission boundary

DescribeRoleList.document: This API (DescribeRoleList) is used to get the role list under the account.
DescribeRoleList.name: Gets a role list

DescribeSafeAuthFlag.document: This API is used to query security settings.
DescribeSafeAuthFlag.name: Queries security settings.

DescribeSafeAuthFlagColl.document: This API is used to query security settings.
DescribeSafeAuthFlagColl.name: Queries security settings

DescribeSubAccounts.document: This API is used to query sub-users through the sub-user UIN list.
DescribeSubAccounts.name: Queries sub-users through sub-user UIN list

DetachGroupPolicy.document: This API (DetachGroupPolicy) is used to unassociate a policy and a user group.
DetachGroupPolicy.name: Unassociate a policy and a user group

DetachRolePolicy.document: This API (DetachRolePolicy) is used to unassociate a policy and a role.
DetachRolePolicy.name: Unassociates a policy and a role

DetachUserPolicy.document: This API (DetachUserPolicy) is used to unassociate a policy and a user.
DetachUserPolicy.name: Unassociates a policy and a user

GetCustomMFATokenInfo.document: This API is used to get information associated with a custom multi-factor Token
GetCustomMFATokenInfo.name: Gets information associated with a custom multi-factor Token

GetGroup.document: This API is used to query user group details.
GetGroup.name: Queries user group details

GetPolicy.document: This API (GetPolicy) is used to query and view policy details.
GetPolicy.name: Views policy details

GetPolicyVersion.document: This API is used to query policy version details.
GetPolicyVersion.name: Queries policy version details

GetRole.document: This API (GetRole) is used to get the details of a specified role.
GetRole.name: Gets role details

GetSAMLProvider.document: This API is used to query SAML identity provider details.
GetSAMLProvider.name: Queries SAML Identity provider details

GetSecurityLastUsed.document: This API is used to get a key’s recent usage details.
GetSecurityLastUsed.name: Gets a key’s recent usage details

GetServiceLinkedRoleDeletionStatus.document: This API is used to get the status of the service-linked role deletion based on the `TaskId`
GetServiceLinkedRoleDeletionStatus.name: Gets the status of the service-linked role deletion

GetUser.document: This API is used to query sub-users.
GetUser.name: Queries sub-users

ListAccessKeys.document: This API is used to list the access keys associated with a specified CAM user.
ListAccessKeys.name: Lists access keys

ListAttachedGroupPolicies.document: This API (ListAttachedGroupPolicies) is used to query the list of policies associated with a user group.
ListAttachedGroupPolicies.name: Queries policy list associated with a user group

ListAttachedRolePolicies.document: This API (ListAttachedRolePolicies) is used to obtain the list of the policies associated with a role.
ListAttachedRolePolicies.name: Gets the list of policies associated with a role

ListAttachedUserPolicies.document: This API (ListAttachedUserPolicies) is used to query the list of policies associated with a sub-account.
ListAttachedUserPolicies.name: Queries policy list associated with a sub-account

ListCollaborators.document: This API is used to get the collaborator list.
ListCollaborators.name: Gets collaborator list

ListEntitiesForPolicy.document: This API (ListEntitiesForPolicy) is used to query the list of entities associated with a policy.
ListEntitiesForPolicy.name: Queries entity list associated with a policy

ListGroups.document: This API is used to query the list of user groups.
ListGroups.name: This API is used to query the list of user groups.

ListGroupsForUser.document: This API is used to list user groups associated with a user.
ListGroupsForUser.name: Lists user groups associated with a user

ListPolicies.document: This API is used to query the policy list.
ListPolicies.name: Queries the list of policies

ListPolicyVersions.document: This API is used to get the list of policy versions.
ListPolicyVersions.name: Gets a list of policy versions

ListSAMLProviders.document: This API is used to query the list of SAML identity providers.
ListSAMLProviders.name: Queries the list of SAML identity providers

ListUsers.document: This API is used to pull sub-users.
ListUsers.name: Pulls sub-users

ListUsersForGroup.document: This API is used to query the list of users associated with a user group.
ListUsersForGroup.name: Queries the list of users associated with a user group

PutRolePermissionsBoundary.document: This API is used to set a role permission boundary.
PutRolePermissionsBoundary.name: Sets role permission boundary

PutUserPermissionsBoundary.document: This API is used to set a user permission boundary.
PutUserPermissionsBoundary.name: Sets user permission boundary

RemoveUserFromGroup.document: This API is used to delete users from a user group.
RemoveUserFromGroup.name: Deletes users from a user group

SetDefaultPolicyVersion.document: This API is used to set the operative policy version.
SetDefaultPolicyVersion.name: Sets operative policy version

SetMfaFlag.document: This API is used to set account verification for login and sensitive operations for sub-users.
SetMfaFlag.name: Sets account verification for login and sensitive operations for sub-users.

UpdateAssumeRolePolicy.document: This API (UpdateAssumeRolePolicy) is used to modify the trust policy of a role.
UpdateAssumeRolePolicy.name: Modifies the trust policy of a role

UpdateGroup.document: This API is used to update a user group.
UpdateGroup.name: Updates a user group

UpdatePolicy.document:
This API is used to update a policy.
This API will update the default version of an existing policy instead of creating a new one. If no policy exists, a default version will be created.
UpdatePolicy.name: Updates policy

UpdateRoleConsoleLogin.document: This API is used to modify a role's login permissions.
UpdateRoleConsoleLogin.name: Modifies a role's login permissions

UpdateRoleDescription.document: This API (UpdateRoleDescription) is used to modify the description of a role.
UpdateRoleDescription.name: Modifies the description of a role

UpdateSAMLProvider.document: This API is used to update SAML identity provider information.
UpdateSAMLProvider.name: Updates SAML identity provider information

UpdateUser.document: This API is used to update a sub-user.
UpdateUser.name: Updates a sub-user

members.document: Sub-user's console login password. If no password rules have been set, the password must have a minimum of 8 characters containing uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters by default. This parameter will be valid only when the sub-user is allowed to log in to the console. If it is not specified and console login is allowed, the system will automatically generate a random 32-character password that contains uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.

members.document: Whether to forcibly delete the sub-user. The default input parameter is `0`. `0`: do not delete the user if the user has undeleted API keys; `1`: first delete the API keys then delete the user if the user has undeleted API keys. To delete API keys, you need to have cam:DeleteApiKey permission, which enables you to delete both enabled and disabled API keys. If you do not have this permission, you will not be able to delete API keys and the user.

members.document: Filter by policy name
members.name: Keyword

members.document: Total number of policies
members.name: TotalNum

members.document:
Policy array. Each array contains fields including `policyId`, `policyName`, `addTime`, `type`, `description`, and `createMode`. 
policyId: policy ID 
policyName: policy name
addTime: policy creation time
type: 1: custom policy, 2: preset policy 
description: policy description 
createMode: 1 indicates a policy created based on business permissions, while other values indicate that the policy syntax can be viewed and the policy can be updated using the policy syntax
Attachments: number of associated users
ServiceType: the product the policy is associated with
IsAttached: this value should not be null when querying if a marked entity has been associated with a policy. 0 indicates that no policy has been associated, and 1 indicates that a policy has been associated
members.name: List

members.document: Policy documentation, for example: `{"version":"2.0","statement":[{"action":"name/sts:AssumeRole","effect":"allow","principal":{"service":["cloudaudit.cloud.tencent.com","cls.cloud.tencent.com"]}}]}`, where `principal` is used to specify the service that is authorized to use the role. For more information about this parameter, see **RoleInfo** under **Output Parameters** in the [GetRole](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/598/36221?from_cn_redirect=1).

members.document: Whether or not the sub-user is allowed to log in to the console. 0: No; 1: Yes.
members.name: ConsoleLogin

members.document: Sub-user's console login password. If no password rules have been set, the password must have a minimum of 8 characters containing uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters by default. This parameter will be valid only when the sub-user is allowed to log in to the console. If it is not specified and console login is allowed, the system will automatically generate a random 32-character password that contains uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.
members.name: Password

members.document: If the sub-user needs to reset their password when they next log in to the console. 0: No; 1: Yes.
members.name: NeedResetPassword
